questions.question: Would you mind …………………………….. for a minute?
questions.description: An ing form is used after would you mind.

questions.question: It isn’t worth …………………………….. to him.
questions.description: An ing form is used after isn't worth.

questions.question: Why are you talking …………………………… such a loud voice?
I wish I ……………………………… English.
questions.description: A past tense is used after I wish to express regrets.

questions.question: I will be happy when I …………………………….. this project.
questions.description: A present tense is used in the when-clause when both the main verb and the subordinate verb refers to the future.

questions.question: Winter is ………………………….. the way.
questions.description: When things are on the way, they are coming.

questions.question: Don’t stand ………………………….. my way.
questions.description: When things are in the way, they obstruct movement.

questions.question: I don’t want ……………………………… to him ever again.
questions.description: A to-infinitive is used after want.

questions.question: He drove in a ………………………………. direction.
questions.description: When these words are adjectives, they do not take -s.

questions.question: We kept going …………………………. until we reached the top.
questions.description: When these words are adverbs, they can be used with or without -s.

questions.question: I will write …………………………….. when I get home.
questions.description: When write has no direct object, we put to before the indirect object.

questions.question: Your hair needs ………………………………….
questions.description: The ing form here means the same as the passive infinitive to be+ past participle.
